tldr: This article presents an anatomical study of a Balaenoptera rostrata, also known as the Piked Whale. The authors describe the external and internal features of the whale, including its head, body, fins, and integument. They also discuss the arrangement of folds on the whale's body, the presence of a dorsal fin, and the number and placement of baleen plates in the upper jaw. The study provides valuable information about the structure and characteristics of this species of whale.
